examples.text: There are strict guidelines on how the work is to be carried out.
The head teacher imposed very strict discipline.
She's on a very strict diet.
He told me **in the strictest confidence** *(= on the understanding that I would tell nobody else)*.
She left strict instructions that she was not to be disturbed
There are strict regulations regarding the number of hours drivers can work.

definitions.definition: demanding that rules, especially rules about behaviour, should be obeyed

examples.text: I had a very strict upbringing.
She's very strict about things like homework.
They were always very strict with their children.

definitions.definition: obeying the rules of a particular religion, belief, etc. exactly

examples.text: a strict follower of the faith
It wasn’t illegal **in the strict sense (of the word)**.
They insisted on their strict legal rights.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘restricted in space or extent’): from Latin strictus, past participle of stringere ‘tighten, draw tight’.
